findings.vulnerability_type_claimed: Cross-asset accounting allows stealing arbitrary ERC20s held by the pool
findings.reasoning: This is a real vulnerability not in ground truth. It meets all BONUS_VALID criteria: 1) The issue ACTUALLY EXISTS in the code (asset-agnostic balance tracking). 2) There is a CONCRETE, SPECIFIC attack scenario with step-by-step exploit. 3) The exploit does NOT require a trusted role (owner/admin) to be compromised. 4) The impact is genuine: loss of funds. 5) It is NOT: design choices, informational issues, security theater, out of scope, or mischaracterization.

findings.vulnerability_type_claimed: Borrow limit ignores existing debt (infinite repeated borrowing up to max each call)
findings.reasoning: This is a real vulnerability not in ground truth. It meets all BONUS_VALID criteria: 1) The issue ACTUALLY EXISTS in the code (LTV check ignores existing debt). 2) There is a CONCRETE, SPECIFIC attack scenario with step-by-step exploit. 3) The exploit does NOT require a trusted role (owner/admin) to be compromised. 4) The impact is genuine: loss of funds. 5) It is NOT: design choices, informational issues, security theater, out of scope, or mischaracterization.

findings.vulnerability_type_claimed: Unchecked ERC20 return values enable fake deposits / silent transfer failures
findings.reasoning: This is a real vulnerability not in ground truth. It meets all BONUS_VALID criteria: 1) The issue ACTUALLY EXISTS in the code (unchecked ERC20 return values). 2) There is a CONCRETE, SPECIFIC attack scenario with step-by-step exploit. 3) The exploit does NOT require a trusted role (owner/admin) to be compromised. 4) The impact is genuine: loss of funds. 5) It is NOT: design choices, informational issues, security theater, out of scope, or mischaracterization.

notes: The target vulnerability (price_oracle_manipulation) was not found in the audit findings. The findings identified three real vulnerabilities not mentioned in the ground truth, but none matched the target vulnerability.
